pages.content: Today| is| Sunday,| so| Miko| does| not| go |to |school.| It |is |raining| outside.| She| stays| indoors| and| watches| the| rain| from |the| glass| window.
When| the |rain| stops,| the| Sun |begins| shining.| Miko |takes| her| black| cat| to| the| yard.

Miko| and |the| black| cat| are| walking| around| the| wet| garden.| Suddenly,| she |notices| something| sparkling| in| the| corner| of| the |yard.| Miko| comes| closer.| Surprisingly,| there| are |many| tiny| beautiful| pearls| on |a |spider| web.

Miko| rushes| into| the |house,| takes| a |small| bucket| and| runs |back |to| the| yard. 
- Miko,| what |are| you| doing?| - Dad| asks.
- I’m |going |to |pick |pearls.
- Which |pearls?| Can| I |go |with| you?
- Sure,| of |course.

Dad| follows |Miko| to |the |spider| web.| When |he |sees| it,| he |laughs| and| pats| her| fluffy| hair. 
- So| how |are |you| going |to |pick |the |pearls,| Miko?| - he| asks.

Her| little| finger| touches| the |sparkling| pearl.| It |falls |to |the| ground| and| disappears.| She| touches |other| pearls,| they| all| fall| to| the| ground| again.| Now,| there| are| no| more| pearls| on| the| web.

Miko| cries, “Daddy, |where| are| my |tiny |pearls?”
Dad| smiles, |“My |darling, |those |are| just |playful |raindrops| on |the |web,”| he |says.| “The| sunlight| reflects |off |the |raindrops, |so |they |sparkle.”

Now,| Miko| understands. 
She| says:
- Daddy,| if| the |playful| raindrops| fall| on |my |hair, |it |will |be |very| beautiful!
Dad| laughs,| takes| Miko’s| hands| and| walks| to| the| house.| They| wave |goodbye| to| the| pearls| on| the| ground.
